title: As a user I want to be able to search for Employee Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN the BOC or CLUB user logs in with Employee Transaction Permission
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Search Type dropdown in Advance search
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" will appear as an option on the dropdown(in alphabetical order) for anyone that has Employee Transaction permissions
AND The filters available when "Employee Transactions" has been selected will match the provided specs. 
AND Clicking search will search the database for any Employee Transactions that meet the applied filters.
AND After results are found, the results will display according to the requirements.
AND Users will be able to export these results to excel.
AND Users will be able to export these results to pdf. 
AND Users will be able to use the type to filter option
AND For BOC Users, all transactions are returned (with the exception of Suppressed, which are only returned if the user specifically adds that filter). 
AND For Club Users, only transactions that are in an Approved or higher state (Reversed) are returned if their Org does not match the Org of the transaction. 
AND For Club users, they can see employee transactions in any state that are for their own Org.

Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Search+-+Employee+Transactions

title: As a user I want a player's Approved for Next Season contract to be moved to Approved when the previous contract expires
custom_preconds:
Expired Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Expired+-+State+Change+Rules
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC approver
AND an employee has a UEC with an Approved for Next Season status
custom_steps: WHEN currently Approved UEC is expired(either manually or via the Contract Expiration Batch)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check to see if the employee has a UEC with an Approved for Next Season status
AND if yes, the Approved for Next Season UEC should be moved to an Approved status

title: As a user I do not want to be able to see UECs converted from 1 that I should not have permission to see
custom_steps: Permissions: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+PermissionsAcceptance Criteria: * All UECs converted from ebis1 will need to follow he new permissions breakdown. The provided mapping should be used to determine which of the new "permission groups" should be able to view the historical UECs.

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Expire UEC batch
custom_preconds: GIVEN CLUB and BOC user  has employee permission
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "Major Contracts" section on the batch screen
custom_expected:
THEN user should see "UEC Expiration Batch" option 
AND Clicking "UEC Expiration Batch" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
AND The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
AND A "Run" button is available. 
AND Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
AND When the batch is run: 
    - Get all approved contracts to be expired (contracts whose latest service end date is in the past.)
    - Iterate over contracts
    - If there are no options - expire the contract
    - If the last year is an option year - expire the contract only if none of the options are exercised.
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired and have contracts that were in "Approved for Next Season" state are updated to "Approved" state
    - If the employee has an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for and it is for the same organization as the contract being expired, then if the employee‰Ûªs current position is different than the position in the contract not being expired, a reassign to org transaction is generated for the employee and Submitted to BOC.
    - If any of the contracts being moved to an "Approved" state overlap with a current Approved contract, then update the status of the existing Approved contract to "Superseded" 
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired who do NOT have an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for the same organization as the contract being expired should have a Remove Employee from Org transaction generated for them and Submitted to BOC.      
AND Results will only include employees who had a contract updated by the batch and should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Errors, Player ID, Name (Last, Roster), Org (current Org), Contract ID, Signing Org (Org contract is with), 
Start Year, Non Option Yrs, Option Yrs, Status (Contract Status)
AND Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/11.+UEC+Expiration+Batch

title: As a BOC user I want expiring a contract to create a Remove from Org transaction, if applicable
custom_preconds:
Expired Rule changes: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Expired+-+State+Change+Rules
Remove Employee from Org Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4.+Remove+Employee+from+Org
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC approver
AND user is attempting to expire a UEC (either manually or via expiration batch)
AND the employee whose contract is being expired does NOT have an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for the same organization as the contract being expired
custom_steps: WHEN UEC is moved to an Expired state, either manually or via the batch
custom_expected:
THEN a Remove Employee from Org transaction should be auto-created and submitted to the BOC
AND all On Submit rules and updates should be made appropriately
BUT if the employee DOES have an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for the same organization as the contract being expired then no Remove from Org should be created

title: As a user I only want an Assign/Reassign transaction created on Submit Signed if the associated UEC will not be moved to Approved for Next Season on Approve
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user logs in with UEC permission
AND user is creating a UEC Approved for Next Season
AND the position on the UEC is different from employee's current position
custom_steps: WHEN user moves the UEC to Submit Signed Status
custom_expected: THEN system should not auto-create an Assign/Reassign for the employee

title: As a User, I want the system to calculate the Employee-centric fields
custom_preconds:
Wire:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_profile
Date Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Profile+Header
GIVEN a user is attempting to Create a new Employee Profile
OR user is viewing an existing Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Employee Profile Header section
custom_expected:
THEN the system should calculate and populate the following fields on the employee profile:
   -- Contract Years
   -- Years with Club
   -- Years in Position
AND these fields should be match the wirerame

title: As a User, I want to see a Employee Bio Update reflected in the Player History
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user logs in with Employee permission
AND user opens an employee profile
custom_steps:
WHEN Any of the following fields are updated and saved:
DOB
Roster Name
First Name
Middle 
Last
Extended Last
Any field within the National ID section
custom_expected:
THEN a line appears in the history of employees for the Bio Update of selected fields
AND the Code = Employee Profile, the Date = date update is made, Description should be "Bio update by *username*. "

NOTE: This story should include the ETL from 1 of any pre-existing history items. 

Wire:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_profile

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Profile+Header

title: As a user I want submitting a UEC to auto-create an Assign/Reassign transaction for the employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged with edit employee contract permissions 
AND user is submitting a employee contract
custom_steps: When user clicks "Submit" button
custom_expected:
THEN If the employee's current position does not match that contained in the UEC, then an Assign/Reassign Transaction is auto-created and submitted by the system for the position contained on the UEC.
AND When a UEC is moved to a submit signed state, an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction is auto-created and submitted for the employee for the position indicated on the UEC. 
AND All stateflow changes and submission/approval updates should follow the Assign/Reassign rules as though it were created manually.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List
Wireframe: 
http://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=place_on_temporary_inactive_list
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with Create New Permissions for Temp Inactive list tx
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to an Employee Profile
AND selects Create New
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" should be an option in the top-level dropdown
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Employee Transactions
AND "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" should be an option in the third level dropdown
AND selecting "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" from the Create New should check to see if there is an existing Preliminary, Submitted to BOC or Rejected MN Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date
AND if a preliminary or rejected transaction already exists, the system should load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction
AND if a submitted transaction already exists, the system should load the existing transaction in View Mode
BUT if no preliminary, submitted or rejected transaction created within 10 days of the current date exists, the system should load a new Preliminary transaction
AND transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery

title: As a user I want to submit a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with create/submit permissions for Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new preliminary or rejected Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN a Submit to BOC button is available to Club users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is blue. 
AND Submit button is available for BOC users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is grey.
AND clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND after the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND system reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification.  
AND once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system sets the employee's pending Status to "Temporarily Inactive".
AND when a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item will be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget. 
AND If a file is attached to the transaction, that is displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget. 
AND If Comments are populated on the transaction, they display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget.
AND employee name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the employee name will open the profile (defaults to History tab) in the same window/tab. 
AND Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab.
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in employee's History in green font. Code = EETMPIN, Description = Place on Temporarily Inactive List, From Org.

See Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Place+on+Temporarily+Inactive+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a BOC user I want to approve or reject a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary or Submitted
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see an "Approve" button in blue 
AND Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.  
AND Update Player's Player History: Code = EETMPIN , Description = Place on Temporarily Inactive List , From Org/Club fields to be in black font. 
AND Update employee's Status to be Temporarily Inactive. 
OR BOC Approves see  "Reject" button when Temporarily Inactive List tx is in Submitted states 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories). 
AND Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND Successful reject notification is displayed. See Messages #15.
AND If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
AND Remove pending history entry.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary or Rejected state, Club users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
AND BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give Clubs access to attach new files, but they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They should also be able to update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND a Save button should be available anytime the form is in edit mode
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Cancel" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT if they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action will be taken

title: Place on Temporarily Inactive List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Club Viewer permissions for Temporarily Inactive list tx
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all Temp InactiveList transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too
BUT user should not be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions 
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
And user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. **Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org**
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: Place on Temporarily Inactive List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions - Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with viewer permissions for Temporarily Inactive list tx
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive list tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too
BUT user should not be able to view or print Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. **Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org**
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should NOT be able to create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the employee I am creating a Place on Deceased List transaction for has an approved transaction after the entered assignment date
custom_preconds:
Business Rule #7.06: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
Error Message #3: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for Deceased List tx
AND user is attempting to submit or approve a Place on Deceased List tx
AND Employee the tx is being created for has an approved transaction dated after the assignment date of the Deceased List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the Assignment date is before the latest approved transaction date for the player
AND if the above condition is met on Clicking submit system should display Messages #3 as follows:
 "A transaction cannot **be scheduled** before the date of the player's latest approved or pending transaction, on <TX Date>."
AND "Ignore and Continue" button should be available (only for BOC and only on submit)
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should continue with transaction submission
AND "Back" button should be available 
AND clicking back should return user to point of entry
BUT if the above condition is met on clicking Approve, system should display messages #3 as follows:
"A transaction cannot **occur** before the date of the player's latest approved or pending transaction, on <TX Date>."
AND "Back" button should be available 
AND clicking back should return user to point of entry

title: As a user I want to submit a Place on Deceased List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
Submission Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with create/submit permissions for Place on Deceased list tx
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new preliminary or rejected Place on Deceased list tx in view or edit mode from create new
custom_expected:
THEN a Submit to BOC button should be available to Club users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button should be blue
AND Submit button should be available for BOC users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button should be grey
AND clicking Submit should run a required field and format check according to the data discovery
AND if any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user should receive an error message
AND clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other test cases - this test case assumes they all pass)
AND after the rules have passed, the system should update the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND system should reload the transaction in view mode, and display a successful submit blue notificationd
AND once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system should set the player's pending Status to "Deceased".
AND when a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item should be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget
AND if a file is attached to the transaction, that should be displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget
AND if Comments are populated on the transaction, they should display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget
AND player name should be a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. 
AND clicking on the player name should open the Player Profile (should default to Player History tab) in the same window/tab 
AND "Type" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction should open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system should create an entry in Player's Player History in green font. Code = DEAD (Not displayed on the front end), Description = Place on Deceased List, From Org.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, reverse and suppress or suppress a Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
Reverse/Suppress Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC approver
AND a Place on Deceased List tx has been approved for an Employee
custom_steps: WHEN BOC approver opens the Approved Place on Deceased List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Reverse" button in grey (in view or edit mode)
AND clicking "Reverse" should run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules should not be run
AND a successful reverse notification should be displayed
AND the transaction status should be updated to "Reversed"
AND reversed transaction should display in player history with "Voided" in front of the transaction description. Example:"Voided: Place on Deceased List"
AND system should set the employee's Status, Club and Org to their values from prior to the transaction approval
AND users that have permission to suppress the form should see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode
AND clicking "Reverse and Suppress" should first reverse, and then suppress the transaction
AND clicking "Suppress" should suppress the transaction
AND when a transaction is suppressed it should be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI
AND clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", should check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction
AND if the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the player, then the user should receive an error message
**Message** "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND user should ONLY have the back option
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction

custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the "Contract Listing by Team" report

title: As a user I want to submit a Place on Suspended List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN CLUB or BOC user logs in with Employee Transaction permission
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens a Place on Suspended List transaction in a preliminary or rejected state (in edit mode or view mode)
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to BOC button is available to Club users in blue. 
AND Submit button is available for BOC users in grey.
AND Clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification.  
AND Once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system sets the employee's pending Status to "Suspended".
AND When a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item will be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget. 
AND If a file is attached to the transaction, that is displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget. 
AND If Comments are populated on the transaction, they display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget.
AND Employee name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the employee name will open the profile (defaults to History tab) in the same window/tab. 
AND "Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab.
AND Once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in employee's History in green font. Code = EESUSPD, Description = Place on Suspended List, From Org.

See Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/5.+Place+on+Suspended+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Suspended+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: Place on Suspended List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Club Viewer permissions for Place on Suspended List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with Place on Suspended List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to  view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
BUT user should not be able to view Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should not be able t see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: Place on Suspended List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions - Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Admin permissions for Temporarily Inactive list tx
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
BUT user should not be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions.
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND Can NOT create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the BOC or Club user logs in with create/edit Employee Transaction permission
AND user opens a new preliminary or rejected Reinstate from Inactive List in view or edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Delete" button
custom_expected:
THEN system will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction and a blue notification should be thrown.
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the BOC or Club user logs in with Employee Transaction permission
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on create new menu icon for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" should an option in the top-level dropdown (already built)
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Employee Transactions.
AND "Reinstate from Inactive List" should be an option in the third level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Reinstate from Inactive List" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary, Submitted to BOC or Rejected MN Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary or rejected transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If a submitted transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in View Mode.
OR If no preliminary, submitted or rejected transaction created within 10 days of the current date exists, the system will load a new Preliminary transaction.
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reinstate+from+Inactive+List

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Reinstate from Inactive List Admin Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with Reinstate from Inactive List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user can view and Print all employee league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
AND user can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.
AND user can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Employee transactions for Employees (or players where applicable). 
AND user can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions and see associated Flags.

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - BOC - Employee Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Reinstate from Inactive List Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with Reinstate from Inactive List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for employees but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: As a user I want to view an existing Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club user logs in with Employee transaction permission
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Reinstate from Inactive List transaction in an employee's History or Advanced Search
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window. 
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey. 
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction. 

Global AC: The field Current Status will display in red if the transaction is in a preliminary state, green if pending and black for all other states.

See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reinstate+from+Inactive+List

custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Club Viewer permissions for Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Reinstate from Inactive List tx
custom_expected:
THEN users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
BUT user should not be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND users should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions
BUT user should not able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org.  Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Club Admin permissions for Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Reinstate from Inactive List tx
custom_expected:
THEN users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
BUT user should not be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND users should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions

title: As a user I want to submit a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Admin permissions for a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new preliminary or rejected a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to BOC button is available to Club users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is blue. 
AND Submit button is available for BOC users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is grey.
AND Clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification.  
AND Once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system sets the employee's pending Status to whatever it was prior to their being placed on the Inactive List. 
AND When a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item will be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget. 
AND If a file is attached to the transaction, that is displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget. 
AND If Comments are populated on the transaction, they display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget.
AND Employee name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the employee name will open the profile (defaults to History tab) in the same window/tab. 
AND "Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab.
AND Once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in employee's History in green font. Code = EERSTIL, Description = Reinstate from (Inactive List) - with (Inactive List) replaced with the type of inactive list they are being reinstated from, From Org.

See Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/9.+Reinstate+from+IL

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reinstate+from+Inactive+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a BOC user I want to approve or reject a Reinstate From Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary or Submitted
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see an "Approve" button in blue when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary or Submitted to BOC if applicable. 
AND Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.  
AND Update Player's Player History: Code = EERSTIL , Description = Reinstate from (Inactive List) , From Org fields to be in black font. 
AND Update employee's Status to be Suspended. 
OR BOC Approves see "Reject" button when Reinstate from Inactive tx is in Submitted states
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories). 
AND Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND Successful reject notification is displayed. 
AND If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
AND Remove pending history entry.

See Approval/Rejection Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/9.+Reinstate+from+IL

See Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, reverse and suppress or suppress a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing a Reinstate from Inactive List (in View or Edit mode) in the Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey
AND Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
AND Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND Display reversed transaction in player history with â€œVoided:â€￾ in front of the transaction description. Example:â€￾ Voided: Major/Minor Outrightâ€￾
AND Set the employee's Status, Club and Org to their values from prior to the transaction approval.
AND Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. 
AND Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the employee's History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
AND Clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", will check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction. 
AND If the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the employee, then the user will receive an error message. 
**Message** "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND User will ONLY have the back option. Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for an employee that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with create permissions for a Reinstate from Inactive List transactions
custom_steps: When user Selects "Reinstate from Inactive List" on  the Employee Transaction create new menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the employee's Current Org is set to the Org of the initiating user. 
AND If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.
AND If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the employee, then display message #1.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Reinstate from Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for Reinstate from Inactive List Transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Reinstate from Inactive List Transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state. 
AND Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode). 
AND In Preliminary or Rejected state, Club users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions. 
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives Clubs access to attach new files, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.  
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. 
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
BUT If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
AND If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reinstate+from+Inactive+List

title: As a user I want to be able to view a Disqualified List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Viewer permissions for a Disqualified List transaction for an employee
AND users Advance search for Disqualified List Transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Disqualified List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN If any Disqualified List transactions existed for employees in ebis1, we need to build the UI and ETL them to ebis2. 
AND  the UI should matches player transaction.
AND user should not be able to enter new, edit, save these transactions.

Wireframe:
https://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=place_on_disqualified_list

title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing trainer/agent profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for trainer/agent profiles 
AND user navigates to L1 Reg tab under International
AND user select a trainer/agent from the widget
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Edit" button
custom_expected:
THEN System will loads the trainer/agent profile in edit mode, per the wire and data discovery. 
AND When on the trainer/agent form in edit mode there is a save button and a cancel button available. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are OK losing their changes. If they confirm, the system will discard the profile and return the user to the point of entry. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 
OR Clicking "Save" will run a required field and format check for the profile and save the profile. 
AND Any updates made to the trainer/agent profile will be reflected in the Trainer/Agent widget as well as on the relevant International Amateur profiles.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=trainer_agent_profile

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347878

title: As a prod user I don't want to see any of the new International Amateur functionality until we are going to production
custom_preconds: GIVEN prod user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to view new International Amateur functionality anywhere in the system
custom_expected: THEN Developers should have a way to show/hide the new International Amateur code without impacting the existing code/functionality.

title: As a user I want to see a warning on a MN Reinstate from DL (for Concussion) if the player is on option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user logs in with approve/edit permissions for a MN Reinstate from DL (for Concussion)
AND user select player that currently on Option with a MN Reinstate from DL (for Concussion) transaction in preliminary or Submitted to BOC status
custom_steps: WHEN user click Submit or Approve on a MN Reinstate from DL transaction
custom_expected:
THEN system will check to see if the player is also currently on Option. 
AND If yes, and the player is being reinstated from a DL placement that includes a concussion, then display Messages #91. 
AND A flag should also appear on the BOC Approvals widget.

Messages #91: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages

Business Rules #20.12.1: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/20.+Reinstate+from+DL

Flags: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/23.+DL+Flags
